page.title: 16Village of North Boarhunt
page.content: {North Boarhunt}before World War I was a small village consisting of lO houses whose inhabitants carried on market gardening. Between the wars the village prospered and expanded to 4O houses, depending on market gardening. Nowadays there are 8O houses and the same activity continues. North Boarhunt is made up of two roads, the A333 and a side road. The main building material is brick with either slate or tile for the roof. The building along the main road tend to be older than those along the side road, which are larger and have often been modernised. The majority of the houses along the main road were built between the wars, whereas those along the side road tended to be built after the Second World War.
